intro: Dortmanna coronopifolia f. bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive bi-colored foliage, with upper leaves often displaying a striking white or pale green hue against the darker green of the lower leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in damp meadows or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and wetland restoration projects.
